1: <sup>1</sup> When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;
2: <sup>2</sup> Judah was his sanctuary, and Israel his dominion.
3: <sup>3</sup> The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was driven back.
4: <sup>4</sup> The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.
5: <sup>5</sup> What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?
6: <sup>6</sup> Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?
7: <sup>7</sup> Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;
8: <sup>8</sup> Which turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.
